intro: Erythranthe charlestonensis, commonly known as Charleston's paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking red to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and wet meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
